paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the A39D variant of the TTR gene, its structural and functional implications, and provides insights into its pathogenicity and penetrance.

functional_data.summary: A39D-TTR is a dimer and not a tetramer, showing decreased thermodynamic stability and increased amyloidogenicity.

variants.segregation_data: Not segregated with disease in families as it does not form hetero-tetramers or hetero-dimers.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on structural and functional studies
variants.additional_notes: The variant A39D-TTR was shown to be highly amyloidogenic and its aggregation was inhibited by diclofenac.
key_quotes: A39D-TTR proved to be highly amyloidogenic, even at mildly acidic pH values where WT-TTR does not aggregate.
A39D-TTR is a dimer and not a tetramer in solution.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a single variant in the TTR gene.
